comment: Dr.McGovern is a really great professor. His lectures are generally short and he doesn't expect too much from students. Very basic weekly discussions, four 2 p. papers, one 10 p. paper at the end of the semester on whatever Ireland related subject you chose.  Very cut and dry, pushed back some deadlines but other than that the class was enjoyable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor is passionate about the subject which is expressed through his teaching. The main assignments were papers and discussions. Then a final research paper that was about ten pages.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Taken during COVID, Dr. McGovern's class was definitely a challenging one. Lots of reading (about 80ish Pgs/week from an 850 Page book) and research, so be prepared. 4 Papers based on the readings, 4 Papers about your research, and a 10-12 Page Research Paper. Definitely learned a lot from this class, though it was also a busy one for me.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: Modern Ireland is one of the best classes I've ever taken at KSU. He is extremely kind and understanding, and when COVID-19 affected our class, he was extremely accommodating to his students' needs. His lectures were extremely informative and engaging. He has a very strict attendance policy, but you'll WANT to attend his lectures.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Modern Ireland is such a great class! 10/10 recommend! McGovern is awesome, you won't regret him.

Take him you won't regret it! He is really strict on going to class but his classes are awesome! I took Modern Ireland and Historical Methods with him and he will work with you! Go to his office he will help you! His tests and quizzes are ALL ALONE even the final! Take him you won't regret!

This man will go above and beyond for you! You just have to do your part and go to class and do THE ONLINE QUIZZES AND TESTS. He is awesome and his lectures are the best! All his stuff is online and its not hard. I love this professor and don't understand why he has such bad reviews on here. Take him, you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: The greatest professor ever. I would take this class again because he is very nice and prepared for every class. Everybody comments bad because they did not do good in his class, and they probably were lazy about assignments.
Difficult grader and he doesn't teach you how to write any historiographical essays. He aspects you to know everything.
One of the hardest classes I have ever taken! If you keep up with the reading you will get an A. Very helpful when it came to writing my paper.

If you know nothing of Irish history, take this class! Ireland is Dr. McGovern's field of study and he is incredibly knowledgable on the subject. The quizzes are easy if you pay attention in class and do the readings. If you answer a question be prepared to stand up for and prove your point. One paper- you choose the topic.

Class 90% of the time will consist of you reading useless articles and discussing in class with zero teaching. There were four papers which were short but graded very tough. It is questionable whether or not he even reads all of the paper or especially the lesson plan you create at the end of the semester. AVOID TAKING HIM!

I absolutely loved this class and Dr. McGovern. I learned so much. He has high expectations because you are in college. Mandatory attendance. 4 papers. It is definitely possible to get an A. Definitely take him if you get the chance! My favorite class I've ever taken in college.

He is a tough professor. If you are not ready to work hard don't take him. He grades papers incredibly hard and is not afraid to call you out. On the other hand, if you take his course, you will be more prepared to move on. Take at own risk!

I took this course in the Fall of 2011. There was a lot of reading articles and class discussion. He does not teach anything, but only comments on people's opinions. What I got out of the class is how to have better class room management skills. He was personally rude to me once in his office along with others in class. Try to avoid this guy!!!!
Amazing Professor!! Very knowledgeable & his affinity for the subject makes it even better. Tests were tricky but not hard. Attendance is mandatory, but so worth it!

He is a very rude and arrogant professor. He encourages class discussion, but he had no notes or powerpoint. Classes consisted of reading 10-20 page articles and discussing in class. He grades the paper as a thesis paper and stops reading if its not interesting.                      Beware of this professor in any class.

One of the most intelligent and literate professors I ever had.  Bad reviews of him come from peoplewo do not want to ease thru school. I am an older student and like the discipline and attendance guides he required.  Grow up kids!  You're adults now!

No idea why he received such bad reviews. He is a great teacher that is open to everyone's opinions. There is a lot of reading but it is to be expected in an upper level class. I highly recommend taking him.
Doesn't teach at all. Test are 100% from the book but overly difficult. Worst personality of any professor I've had, overly arrogant, and overall a total jerk.
He doesn't actually teach anything. All group work. Seems annoyed by students and not at all a caring professor. Big disappointment.
Rude, unintresting don't take
Knowledgable and approachable professor.  Promptly responds to emails and questions.  Workload is what is to be expected of a 4490-level course.  Would take again.

No doubt that he is a very hard teacher, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. He knows the material, was able to answer questions in and outside of class, and even though the class was hard it was enjoyable. You have to do the readings and expect to study. Attendance is mandatory, but he makes that VERY clear from the first days of the semester.

I thought he was a very good professor, and he had no problem helping you if you asked him to. You won't do well if you don't study, but this is college, folks. I got an A, and I suspect that those giving poor reviews of Dr. McGovern were probably irritated that they couldn't sleep through class and still get the B they aspire to slide by with.

This is by far the rudest and unkind professor at KSU. For our class he had family issues and missed class.. and still required us to know all the material that he did not teach for two weeks.  He called people out in class and seemed to know less than some of the students.  DO NOT TAKE HIM if you are looking for a simple class and an easy a.

Don't take him. He doesn't know dates, but expects you to know specifics. I was really passionate about the subject and he made the semester horrible. His tests and quizzes are too difficult, random, and ambiguous. I wouldn't recommend taking him.

For a gen ed class it was needlessly difficult.He missed 2 weeks of an 8 week summer class for personal reasons which is ok but he didn't cut the class any slack. He didn't give study guides,extra credit was a joke, and test questions were very specific.No matter how much I studied I still did poor in the class while making A's in my other 3.
